abstract: The drug maker Mylan is suing the Food and Drug Administration in an attempt to upend its rival Ranbaxy’s exclusive rights to produce a generic form of Diovan, a blood pressure drug.
snippet: The drug maker Mylan is suing the Food and Drug Administration in an attempt to upend its rival Ranbaxy’s exclusive rights to produce a generic form of Diovan, a blood pressure drug.
lead_paragraph: The Swiss drug maker Novartis had been bracing all year for the day in late September when Diovan, its top-selling blood pressure drug, would lose patent protection and a cheaper generic version would become available.

headline.main: Lawsuit Challenges Ranbaxy’s Rights to Generic Drug
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Challenges Ranbaxy’s Rights to Generic Drug
